ui.bodyBullet: Exceed customer expectations throughout the ownership cycle to earn loyalty
Retain customers for repeat purchases
Earn referrals and recommendations
Companies whose foundation is built on customer loyalty grow through <u>all</u> economic climates

ui.bodyImage: Sales Consultant shaking hands with happy customers

ui.bodyBullet: • Customer satisfaction does not necessarily mean customer loyalty
• In the automotive industry, satisfaction has improved, customer loyalty has not
Surveys customers over the ownership lifecycle – at various points in time
Loyal enthusiasts who will buy again and refer others
Satisfied but unenthusiastic customers very vulnerable to the competition. These customers should be considered low hanging fruit – hopefully easy to convert to a Promoter with a small wow factor
Unhappy customers who can damage your dealership’s reputation through negative word-of-mouth, not to mention potentially not returning for future business

ui.bodyImage: Service Advisor with customer at Express Lane or tire area

ui.bodyBullet: • CPS goes beyond the numbers
• Most valuable results are customer audio recordings and emails
• Customer comments provide priceless feedback in customers’ own words
Audio recordings, emails, and reports are located on DealerCONNECT
• Customer comments give you the opportunity to take immediate action
• Always consult your manager for specific situations
• Service, Parts, and Warranty professionals are members of multiple teams
• In a successful dealership all teams work together to earn customer loyalty
• Communication and collaboration between departments is key to dealership growth and profitability
• Service Advisors consistently apply Chrysler’s Repair Process, which is proven to enhance dealership profitability, customer loyalty, and retention
Click on Inquiry to continue.
Service Advisor works to identify customer needs while establishing a positive relationship.
• Initial greeting is a crucial first step in the relationship
• Top performing Service Advisors:
• Develop a sincere, professional greeting style
• Use active listening skills
• Service and Warranty collaborate to identify warranty and non-warranty work
• Comprehensive, accurate vehicle needs assessment
• Service Advisor obtains customer approval, prepares RO

ui.bodyImage: Service Advisor with customer at vehicle with tablet

ui.bodyBullet: A coordinated process leading to a quality, on-time repair by:
• Matching the right technician to the job
• Ensuring the required tools and parts are available
• Communication between Service Advisors, Technicians, Parts team
• Factory-trained technicians conduct repair and service
• Parts Department ensures that the right parts are used
• Service Advisor monitors progress and updates the customer as needed
Service Advisor presents the vehicle and ensures that the customer fully understands and is satisfied with the completed work.

ui.bodyImage: Service Advisor with customer delivering vehicle
Service Advisor with customer at cashier desk/window

ui.bodyBullet: Service Advisor contacts the customer within 2 business days to ensure they are fully satisfied with the work and their experience at your dealership.
DealerCONNECT
• Vehicle Information Plus (VIP)
• Claim Administration
• Quick LOPS (Labour Operations)
• Making vehicle maintenance and repair stress-free for your customers increases their loyalty to your dealership
• Extended hours help increase service business
• Express Lane is a key factor in retaining service customers
• Express Lanes dealerships see 50% increase
• 10% is non-Chrysler Group brands
• Chrysler Group/Magneti Marelli partnership allows dealers to:
• Service all makes
• Sell retail/wholesale for all makes
• Stocking and promoting accessories and tires is another profitable way to build business and retain customers
• Service, Parts, and Warranty professionals are members of multiple teams
• In a successful dealership all teams work together to earn customer loyalty
• Communication and collaboration between departments is key to dealership growth and profitability

ui.item: Parts Advisors support the Repair Process by quickly and accurately identifying, specifying, and providing needed parts
Require a knowledgeable Parts Advisor who can consult with these customers to ensure their satisfaction
By meeting these customers’ needs and providing excellent service, you help their businesses grow – which helps your business grow

ui.bodyBullet: No matter which customer, the Parts Process is the same. Each step should be followed with a commitment to customer satisfaction.
Click on Inquiry to continue.
Accurately identify the parts needed by the customer
Provide correct part numbers and identify related parts and their numbers

ui.bodyImage: Parts Advisor on phone with customer

ui.bodyBullet: Provide parts in stock from inventory or quickly obtain parts not in inventory.

ui.bodyImage: Parts Advisor on phone with customer

• STARPARTS

• Mopar.ca

  • First choice for maintenance, repair, collision jobs

• Services all makes/models
  • Sell retail and wholesale for all makes

• In a successful dealership all teams work together to earn customer loyalty
• Communication and collaboration between departments is key to dealership growth and profitability
• The Warranty Administrator collects information from the Service Advisor to be able to prepare and process dealership warranty claims
Click on Review to continue.
The Warranty Administrator collects and reviews warranty information for vehicle
Enter information into Claim Administration section, Service page on DealerCONNECT
For a rejected claim, review and resubmit with required corrections

Goodwill Adjustment Program
• Provides assistance to customers in certain out-of-warranty repair situations
• Review goodwill procedures with your Service Manager
